CLARA". "Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be.
There was a call for you at the office.
Fancy a week in Ancient Mesopotamia, followed by future Mars?
How's the new job? Teach anything good?
PILOT OVER RADIO: Wait for it to level, Greyhound leader.
Blue Eagle is airborne and ready to receive.
Kate Stewart's phone. Oh, hold on.
The ravens are looking a bit sluggish.
Tell Malcolm we need new batteries.
Sorry. It's your personal phone, but I recognised the ringtone.
We found the Tardis in a field.
We had no idea you were still in there.
I don't think he can hear me.
(YELLS) Next time, would it kill you to knock?
I'm having you taken directly to the scene.
I'm just going to pop you on hold.
As Chief Scientific Officer, may I extend the official apologies of UNIT...
Kate LethbridgeStewart, a word to the wise.
As I'm sure your father would have told you, I don't like being picked up.
That probably sounded better in his head.
I'm acting on instructions direct from the throne.
Sealed orders from Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth the First.
What's our cover story for this?
GUARD: Attention! Right, I want a secure perimeter around the gallery.
Did you know her? Elizabeth the First?
This lot. UNIT. They investigate alien stuff. Anything alien.
Why shouldn't I have a job?
I'd be brilliant at having a job.
I do. This is my job. I'm doing it now.
Not in this time or place.
It's the fa ll of Arcadia, Ga llifrey's second city.
But how is it doing that?
A slice of real time, frozen.
KATE: Elizabeth told us where to find it, and its significance.
The one I don't talk about.
I've had many faces. Many lives.
I don't admit to all of them.
There's one life I've tried very hard to forget.
He was the Doctor who fought in the Time War, and that was the day he did it.
The day he killed them all.
The last day of the Time War, the war to end all wars between my people and the Daleks.
And in that battle, there was a man with more blood on his hands than any other.
A man who would commit a crime that would silence the universe.
A message for the High Council.
Soldier, I'm going to need your gun.
Inform High Command, we have the Doctor.
ANDROGAR: The High Council is in emergency session.
They have plans of their own.
GENERAL: To hell with the High Council.
Gallifrey's still in the line of fire.
A written warning for the Daleks.
As you can see, sir, all Dalek fleets surrounding the planet are now converging on the capitol, but the Sky Trenches are holding.
This is their biggest ever attack.
Sir, they're throwing everything at us.
We have a security breach to the Time Vaults.
Where all the forbidden weapons are locked away.
We've used them all against the Daleks.
I don't understand. What is the Moment?
The final work of the ancients of Gallifrey.
A weapon so powerful, the operating system became sentient.
According to legend, it developed a conscience.
How do you use a weapon of ultimate mass destruction when it can stand in judgment on you?
GENERAL". There is only one man who would even try.
OLD DOCTOR: Time Lords of Gallfray, Daleks of Skaro, I serve notice on you all.
Too long have I stayed my hand.
Today, you leave me no choice.
Why is there never a big red button?
Because it's not a chair, it's the most dangerous weapon in the universe.
Why'd you park so far away?
Didn't you want her to see it?
And miles and miles and miles.
It's activated. Get out of here.
They must have told you the Moment had a conscience.
Stuck between a girl and a box.
Story of your life, eh, Doctor?
All of you, jangling around in that dusty old head of yours.
I chose this face and form especially for you.
I always get those two mixed up.
In this form, I'm called Bad Wolf.
Are you afraid of the big bad wolf, Doctor?
That's the name in your head.
I've been fighting this war for a long time.
I've lost the right to be the Doctor.
Then you're the one to save us all.
If I ever develop an ego, you've got the job.
If you have been inside my head, then you know what I have seen.
Every moment in time and space is burning.
And I intend to end it the only way I can.
And you're going to use me to end it by killing them all, Daleks and Time Lords alike.
But there will be consequences for you.
I have no desire to survive this.
If you do this, if you kill them all, then that's the consequence.
You're going to burn it, and all those Daleks with it, but all those children, too.
How many children on Gallifrey right now?
One day, you will count them.
Do you want to see what that will turn you into?
I'm opening windows on your future.
The tangle in time through the days to come to the man today will make of you.
But the Time War's over. Why have you brought us here to look at a painting?
KATE: The painting only serves as Elizabeth's credentials, proof that the letter is from her.
ELIZABETH : My dearest love, I hope the painting known as Gallifrey Falls will serve as proof that it is your Elizabeth who writes to you now.
You will recall that you pledged yourself to the safety of my kingdom.
In this capacity, I have appointed you as curator of the UnderGallery, where deadly danger to England is locked away.
Should any disturbance occur within its walls, it is my wish that you be summoned.
Understood, sir, but why would I take it there?
There you go, Your Majesty, what did I tell you?
You nearly took my head off.
It's normally me who does that.
ELIZABETH: Tell me, Doctor, why I'm wasting my time on you.
You have a picnic to eat.
Well, I'm helping you eat the picnic.
But you have a stomach for war.
Oh, I've seen conflict like you wouldn't believe.
But never mind that, Your Majesty!
Oh, my dear sweet love, of course I will.
One, the real Elizabeth would never have accepted my marriage proposal.
Two, the real Elizabeth would notice when I just casually mention having a different face.
But then, the real Elizabeth isn't a shapeshifting alien from outer space.
Made it myself. Lights up in the presence of shapeshifter DNA.
Also, it can microwave frozen dinners from up to 20 feet, and download comics from the future.
I never know when to stop.
My love, I do not understand.
I'm not your love, and yes, you do.
Oh, stop it, it's over. A Zygon, yes.
Big red rubbery thing, covered in suckers. Surprisingly good kisser.
Do you think the real queen of England would just decide to share her throne with any old handsome bloke in a tight suit, just 'cause he's got amazing hair and a nice horse...
We're being attacked by a shapeshifting alien from outer space, formerly disguised as my horse.
It means we're going to need a new horse.
You run. Your people need you.
And I need you alive for our wedding day.
Oh, good work, Doctor. Nice one.
Come on! I know you're there!
Whatever you've got planned, forget it. I'm the Doctor.
I'm from the planet Gallifrey in the constellation of Kasterborous.
I am the oncoming storm, the bringer of darkness, and you...
are basically just a rabbit, aren't you?
That thing, explain what it is.
What does it want of us?
That's what I'm trying to find out.
That's not me. That's the creature.
How is that possible? She's me!
A compliment that cannot be extended to yourself.
Extraordinary. The creature has captured my exact likeness.
A queen would call it impertinent.
A queen would feel compelled to admire the skill of the execution, before arranging one.
One might surmise that the creature would learn quickly to protect itself from any simple means of detection.
Clearly, you understand the creature better than I.
But then, you have the advantage.
A tear in the fabric of reality.
This is where Elizabeth I kept all art deemed too dangerous for public consumption.
In 1,200 years, I've never stepped in anything that wasn't.
Good. I've always wanted to meet someone called "Yes".
Now, I want this stone dust analysed.
And I want a report, in triplicate, with lots of graphs and diagrams and complicated sums, on my desk, tomorrow morning, ASAP, pronto, LOL.
See?job. Do I have a desk?
Get a team. Analyse the stone dust.
Someday, you could just walk past a fez.
This is why we called you in.
The glass in all these paintings has been broken from the inside.
As you can see, all the paintings are landscapes.
Something's got out of the paintings?
This whole place has been searched.
There's nothing here that shouldn't be, and nothing's got out.
Is it to do with the paintings?
This is where I come in.
That's just what I was wondering.
I've never seen it from the outside.
"I'm the Doctor, and I'm all cool.
"Oops, I'm wearing sandshoes."  What are you doing here? I'm busy.
Is that what we're calling it, eh? Eh?
Listen, what you get up to in the privacy of your own regeneration is your business...
One of them is a Zygon.
Probably a good time to run.
BOTH: But what about the creature?
Elizabeth, whichever one of you is the real one, turn and run in the opposite direction to the other one.
I am not done with you yet.
One of those was a Zygon?
Big red rubbery thing covered in suckers? Venom sacs in the tongue?
Yeah, I'm getting the point, thank you.
Ah, hello, Clara! Can you hear me?
Yeah, it's me. We can hear you.
Physical passage may not be possible in both directions. It's... Ah!
Malcolm, I need you to send me one of my father's incident files.
Codenamed "Cromer". '70s or '80s, depending on the dating protocol.
Okay. You used to be me.
Hey, hang on, it's not my fault.
You're obviously not paying enough attention. Reverse the polarity.
There's two of us. I'm reversing it, and you're reversing it back again.
More to the point, why are you here?
Well, you've certainly come to the right place.
Good. Right. Who are you boys?
Of course. Are you his companions?
They get younger all the time.
Well, if you could point me in the general direction of the Doctor...
Am I having a midlife crisis?
Why are you pointing your screwdrivers like that?
They are scientific instruments, not waterpistols!
You look like you've seen a ghost.
Still, loving the posh, gravelly thing.
Which of you is the Doctor?
The Queen of England is bewitched.
I would have the Doctor's head.
Well, this has all the makings of your lucky day.
(WHISPERS) I think there's three of them now.
KATE". There's a precedent for that.
What are you going to do, assemble a cabinet at them?
That thing, what witchcraft is it?
Ah! Yes, now that you mention it, that is witchcraft.
Hello in there, excuse me, hello.
Am I talking to the wicked witch of the well?
Hello. Would you mind telling these prattling mortals to get themselves begone?
Or I'll turn you all into frogs.
I've no idea where he picks that stuff up.
You don't seem to be kneeling.
What happened to the other one?
That is not the Queen of England.
And you can take it from him, 'cause he's really checked.
Love the Tower. Breakfast at 8:00, please. Will there be wifi?
Are you capable of speaking without flapping your hands about?
Yes. No. I demand to be incarcerated in the Tower immediately with my coconspirators,  Sandshoes and Grandad.
Silence. The Tower is not to be taken lightly.
KATE: Dear God, that man's clever.
My office, otherwise known as the Tower of London.
JAILER: Oi, you lot, get in there.
TENTH DOCTOR: Three of us in one cell?
That's going to cause some nasty anomalies if we don't get out soon.
The sonic won't work on that.
Shall we ask for a better quality of door, so we can escape?
Okay, so the Queen of England is now a Zygon.
Me and Chinny, we were surprised, but you came looking for us.
You knew it was going to happen.
Yeah, you do have a chin.
A lot of different stone, but none of it from the fabric of the building.
It's like somebody smashed up a lot of old statues.
Why would anyone do that, anyway?
I mean, I know we're meant to keep an open mind, but are we supposed to believe in creatures that can hide in oil paintings and have some sort of a grudge against statues?
We have to go, right now.
I know why they smashed the statues.
Because they needed somewhere to hide.
(MUFFLED SCREAMING) The Doctor will save me.
The Doctor will save me, the Doctor will save me...
Excuse me. I'm going to need my inhaler.
I so hate it when I get one with a defect.
Ooh, you've got some perfectly horrible memories in here, haven't you?
So jealous of your pretty sister.
KATE: The Doctor will be trying to send us a message.
We're looking for a string of numerals, from around 1550, approximately.
Priority one. I'm going to need access to the Black Archive.
Black Archive. Highest security rating on the planet.
The entire staff have their memories wiped at the end of every shift.
Automated memory filters on the ceiling. Access, please.
Can't afford electronic security down here. Got to keep the Doctor out.
The whole of the Tower is Tardisproofed.
He really wouldn't approve of the collection.
You have a toplevel security rating from your last visit.
KATE: Apologies. We have to screen all his known associates.
Can't have information about the Doctor and the Tardis falling into the wrong hands.
A vortex manipulator bequeathed to the UNIT archive by Captain jack Harkness on the occasion of his death.
No one can know we have this, not even our allies.
Americans with the ability to rewrite history.
Okay, so this is how we're going to rescue the Doctor?
KATE: Not sure there's enough power for a twoway trip.
In any event, we don't have the activation code.
The Doctor knows we have this, so he's always kept the code from us.
Let's hope he changes his mind.
Well, if you've found it, photograph it and send it to my phone.
Oh, they've probably just finished disposing of the humans a bit early.
I really do get into character, don't I?
ZYGON: Prepare to dispose of one more human.
In theory, I can trigger an isolated sonic shift among the molecules, and the door should disintegrate.
You'd have to calculate the harmonic resonance of the entire structure down to a subatomic level.
Even the sonic would take years.
No, no. The sonic would take centuries.
Well, we might as well get started.
Do you have to talk like children?
What is it that makes you so ashamed of being a grownup?
Oh, the way you both look at me.
I'm trying to think of a better word than "dread".
Must be really recent, for you.
The Time War. The last day.
The day you killed them all.
The day we killed them all.
It's history for them. All decided.
They think their future is real.
They don't know it's still up to you.
Ask them what you need to know.
How many children there were on Gallifrey, that day.
I don't know. I lose track.
Twelve hundred and something, I think. Unless I'm lying.
I can't remember if I'm lying about my age, that's how old I am.
Four hundred years older than me.
And in all that time, you never even wondered how many there were?
Tell me, what would be the point?
Where can you be now, that you can forget something like that?
No, no, no. For once, I would like to know where I'm going.
I don't know who you are, either of you.
I haven't got the faintest idea.
They're what you become, if you destroy Gallifrey.
The man who regrets, and the man who forgets.
Did I miss a funny thing?
It just occurred to me, this is what I'm like when I'm alone.
Well, at a software level, they're all the same device, aren't they?
It would take centuries for the screwdriver to calculate how to disintegrate the door.
Scanning the door, implanting the calculation as a permanent subroutine in the software architecture...
And if you really are me, with your sandshoes and your dickiebow, and that screwdriver is still mine, that calculation is still going on.
We may have had our differences, which is frankly odd, in the circumstances, but I tell you what, boys, we are incredibly clever.
So they're both you, then, yeah?
Three of you in one cell, and none of you thought to try the door?
Yes, exactly. Why wasn't it locked?
Because I was fascinated to see what you would do upon escaping.
I understand you're rather fond of this world.
It's time, I think, you saw what's going to happen to it.
Kate! Goodness, you're not actually dead.
Those creatures, they turn themselves into copies.
Maybe they need to keep the original alive.
Refresh the image, so to speak.
I don't know. Hang on, yes, I do.
If those creatures have got access to the Black Archive, we may just have lost control of the planet.
The Zygons lost their own world.
It burned in the first days of the Time War.
CLARA: So they want this one?
Zygons are used to a certain level of comfort.
Because I say they should be.
It is time you, too, were translated.
I believe you will find it fascinating.
That's him. That's the Zygon, in the picture, now.
OLD DOCTOR: It's not a picture.
Bigger on the inside, but could be deployed as...
The Zygons all pop inside the pictures, wait a few centuries till the planet's a bit more interesting and then out they come.
You see, Clara? They're stored in the paintings in the UnderGallery like CupaSoups, except you add time, if you can picture that.
And now the world is worth conquering.
CLARA: So the Zygons are invading the future from the past?
And do you know why I know that you're a fake?
Because you're such a bad copy.
It's not just the smell, or the unconvincing hair, or the atrocious teeth, or the eyes just a bit too close together, or the breath that could stun a horse.
It's because my Elizabeth, the real Elizabeth, would never be stupid enough to reveal her own plan.
Honestly, why would you do that?
And I am the real Elizabeth.
Okay, so, backtracking a moment just to lend some context to my earlier remarks...
My twin is dead in the forest.
I am accustomed to taking precautions.
These Zygon creatures never even considered that it was me who survived, rather than their own commander.
The arrogance that typifies their kind.
And you actually killed one of them?
I may have the body of a weak and feeble woman, but at the time, so did the Zygon.
The future of my kingdom is imperilled.
Doctor, can I rely on your service?
I'm going to need my Tardis.
But first, my love, you have a promise to keep.
PRIEST: I now pronounce you man and wife.
Is there a lot of this in the future?
It does start to happen, yeah.
ELEVENTH DOCTOR: Right then, back to the future.
You've let this place go a bit.
Three of us from different time zones.
Oh, yeah? Oh, you never do. Listen.
We're going to the National Gallery.
No, UNIT HQ. They followed us there.
Okay, so you've heard of that, then.
The humans don't realise what half this stuff does.
We could conquer their world in a day.
ZYGON: We were fortunate, then, in our choice of duplicate.
If I were human, I'd say it was Christmas.
We're not armed. You may relax.
ZYGON: We are armed. You may not.
I'm afraid we can't be interrupted.
You don't mind if I get comfortable?
You don't mind if I do?
You'll realise there are protocols protecting this place. Osgood?
In the event of alien incursion, the contents of this room are deemed so dangerous, it will selfdestruct in...
There's a nuclear warhead Are you sitting comfortably?
To save the world? Yes, I would.
Somewhere in your memory is a man called Brigadier Alistair Gordon LethbridgeStewart.
Is that what your father meant?
A gift from me to your father.
I know about the Black Archive, and I know about the security protocol.
Please tell me you are not about to do something unbelievably stupid.
I'm sorry, Doctor. Switch it off.
Not as sorry as you will be.
This is not a decision you will ever be able to live with!
Argh! We're trying to bring the Tardis in. Why can't we land?
No, Kate, please, just listen to me!
CLARA: How can they do that?
Yeah, we do, a tiny bit.
Take a look at your phone and confirm who you're talking to.
You were just talking to me. I know.
I'm a timetraveller. Figure it out.
I need you to send the Gall/fray Falls painting to the Black Archive.
Understood, sir, but why would I take it there?
ALIEN KATE: One word from you would cancel the countdown.
It's keyed to your voice print.
We only have to agree to live.
Sadly, we can only agree to die.
Please save us, please save us, please save us, please save us...
Kate LethbridgeStewart, what in the name of sanity are you doing?
The countdown can only be halted at my personal command.
Except make you both agree to halt it.
Not even for three of you.
You're about to murder millions of people.
To save billions. How many times have you made that calculation?
Once. It turned me into the man I am now.
Not even sure who that is any more.
You tell yourself it's justified, but it's a lie, because what I did that day was wrong.
And because I got it wrong, I'm going to make you get it right.
Any second now, you're going to stop that countdown.
And then you're going to negotiate the most perfect treaty of all time.
And the key to perfect negotiation...
...is not knowing what side you're on.
So, for the next few hours, until we decide to let you out...
No one in this room will be able to remember if they're human or a Zygon.
It's funny, isn't it? If I'm a Zygon, then my clothes must be Zygon too.
So, what happens if I lose a shoe or something?
My Doctor... He's always talking about the day he did it.
The day he wiped out the Time Lords to stop the war.
I see it in his eyes every day.
He'd do anything to change it.
How many worlds has his regret saved, do you think?
Look over there. Humans and Zygons, working together in peace.
Then, all things considered, it's time I grew up.
ROSE: Well, you wanted a big red button.
One big bang. No more Time Lords, no more Daleks.
I was sure when I came in here.
You've seen the men you will become.
Great men are forged in fire.
It is the privilege of lesser men to light the flame.
You know the sound the Tardis makes?
That sound brings hope wherever it goes.
Yes. Yes, I like to think it does.
To anyone who hears it, Doctor.
(WHISPERS) I told you he hasn't done it yet.
Go away, now. All of you.
Go and be the Doctor that I could never be.
TENTH DOCTOR: All those years burying you in my memory.
ELEVENTH DOCTOR: Pretending you didn't exist.
Keeping you a secret, even from myself.
TENTH DOCTOR: Pretending you weren't the Doctor, when you were the Doctor more than anybody else.
You were the Doctor on the day it wasn't possible to get it right.
But this time, you don't have to do it alone.
What we do today is not out of fear or hatred.
It is done because there is no other way.
And it is done in the name of the many lives we are failing to save.
You told me you wiped out your own people. I just...
I never pictured you doing it.
ROSE: It's the reality around you.
These are the people you're going to burn?
There isn't anything we can do.
You're right. There isn't another way.
Either I destroy my own people, or let the universe burn.
Look at you. The three of you.
Any old idiot can be a hero.
CLARA". You told me the name you chose was a promise. What was the promise?
Never give up. Never give in.
You're not actually suggesting that we change our own personal history?
We change history all the time.
Gentlemen, I have had 400 years to think about this.
There's still a billion billion Daleks up there, attacking.
Yep, there is. There is. But...
there's something those billion billion Daleks don't know.
'Cause if they did, they'd probably send for reinforcements.
This time, there's three of us.
Oh! Oh, I'm getting that too!
I've been thinking about it for centuries.
She didn't just show me any old future.
She told me exactly the future I needed to see!
Bad Wolf Girl, I could kiss you.
Sorry, did you just say "Bad Wolf"?
The Dalek fleets are surrounding Gallifrey, firing on it constantly.
But what if the whole planet just disappeared?
The Daleks would be firing on each other.
They'd destroy themselves in their own crossfire.
And it would look to the rest of the universe as if they'd annihilated each other.
Frozen in an instant of time, safe and hidden away.
GENERAL: Are you sure the message is from him?
What's the mad fool talking about now?
A so the Doctor. Can you hear me?
All my worst nightmares at once.
We should point out at this moment it is a fairly terrible plan, and almost certainly won't work.
was happy with "fairly terrible. " Sorry, I was just thinking aloud.
We are flying our three Tardises into your lower atmosphere.
We're positioned at equidistant intervals around the globe.
Just about ready to do it.
Using our Tardises, we're gonna freeze Gallifrey in a single moment in time.
You know, like those Stasis Cubes?
Single moment in time, held in a parallel pocket universe.
Except we're going to do it to a whole planet.
And all the people on it.
Even if that were possible, which it isn't, why would you do such a thing?
And I never want to see it again.
We'd be lost in another universe, frozen in a single moment.
And right now, that is exactly what you don't have.
Why, the calculations alone would take hundreds of years.
I started a very long time ago.
Warning the War Council of Gallifrey.
ELEVENTH DOCTOR: You might say I've been doing this all my lives.
Across the boundaries that divide one universe from another.
I didn't know when I was well off.
ANDROGAR: Sir, the Daleks know that something is happening.
Do it, Doctor. just do it.
I don't suppose we'll ever know if we actually succeeded.
But at worst, we failed doing the right thing, as opposed to succeeding in doing the wrong.
Either No More or Gallifrey Falls.
There's always something we don't know, isn't there?
OLD DOCTOR: I should certainly hope so.
Well, gentlemen, it has been an honour and a privilege.
And if I grow to be half the man that you are, Clara Oswald, I shall be happy indeed.
I won't remember this, will I?
The timestreams are out of sync.
So I won't remember that I tried to save Gallifrey, rather than burn it.
And I have to live with that.
But for now, for this moment, I am the Doctor again.
I hope the ears are a bit less conspicuous this time.
I won't remember, either, so you might as well tell me.
Where it is we're going that you don't want to talk about.
I saw Trenzalore, where we're buried.
We die in battle, among millions.
That's not how it's supposed to be.
Nothing we can do about it.
Anyway, good to know my future is in safe hands.
Keep a tight hold on it, Clara.
We need a new destination, because...
Need a moment alone with your painting?
Oh, by the way, there was an old man looking for you.
I think it was the curator.
I'd be the Great Curator. (CHUCKLES) I could retire, and do that.
I could retire, and be the curator of this place.
CURATOR: You know, I really think you might.
And in years to come, you might find yourself revisiting a few.
But just the old favourites, eh?
You were curious about this painting, I think?
I acquired it in remarkable circumstances.
What do you make of the title?
No, you see, that's where everybody's wrong.
Now, what would you think that means, eh?
It worked? It's still out there?
Things do get lost, you know.
And now, you must excuse me.
Oh, you have a lot to do.
Is that what I'm supposed to do now?
I can only tell you what I would do.
Perhaps I was you, of course.
Or perhaps it doesn't matter either way.
ELEVENTH DOCTOR". Clara sometimes asks me if I dream.
"Everybody dreams." "But what do you dream about?" she'll ask.
"The same thing everybody dreams about," I tell her.
"I dream about where I'm going." She always laughs at that.
You're just wandering about." That's not true.
My journey is the same as yours.
It's taken me so many years, so many lifetimes, but at last, I know where I'm going.
Where I have always been going.
